title: Domain 4.4: Explain security alerting and monitoring concepts and tools.
content:
🖥️ Monitoring Computing Resources

🧠 Systems

  • Monitor OS-level events (e.g., user logins, service failures, unusual CPU usage).

💻 Applications

  • Track application logs and behavior for signs of misuse, vulnerabilities, or crashes.

🏗️ Infrastructure

  • Includes network hardware, servers, and cloud—look for anomalies, downtime, or intrusions.

🔄 Monitoring Activities

📚 Log Aggregation

  • Centralizes logs from multiple sources for correlation, analysis, and long-term storage.

🚨 Alerting

  • Triggers notifications when predefined thresholds or suspicious behaviors are detected.

🔍 Scanning

  • Regular checks for vulnerabilities, open ports, or configuration issues.

📝 Reporting

  • Summarizes findings for review—used for audits, compliance, and incident tracking.

📦 Archiving

  • Long-term storage of logs and reports—important for forensics, legal, or historical review.

🛡️ Alert Response and Remediation / Validation

🔐 Quarantine

  • Isolate affected systems or files to prevent spread while investigation occurs.

🎛️ Alert Tuning

  • Adjust thresholds and rules to reduce false positives and focus on true threats.

🧰 Monitoring & Security Tools

🧩 Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP)

  • Framework for automating vulnerability scanning, configuration checks, and patch validation—standardizes security evaluation.

📏 Benchmarks

  • Security baselines (like CIS benchmarks) define best practices for hardening systems and evaluating compliance.

👥 Agents / Agentless

  • Agents: Installed on systems for deep visibility and control.
  • Agentless: Uses network protocols (e.g., SSH, WMI) for monitoring without local installation.

📊 SIEM (Security Information and Event Management)

  • Centralizes log collection, correlation, and alerting in real-time—key tool for detecting and responding to threats.

🦠 Antivirus

  • Detects and removes malware based on signatures and behavioral analysis—essential endpoint protection.

🛡️ DLP (Data Loss Prevention)

  • Prevents unauthorized sharing or leakage of sensitive data—can block emails, file transfers, etc.

📡 SNMP Traps (Simple Network Management Protocol)

  • Alerts sent from devices to central systems when specific events occur—used in network monitoring.

🌐 NetFlow

  • An analysis of network traffic patterns and flows—useful for detecting anomalies or lateral movement.

🔎 Vulnerability Scanners

  • Tools like Nessus or OpenVAS scan systems for known vulnerabilities and misconfigurations.
